instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> solved thank you.
threads.message: hi friends , the fan want it to spin just a little almost nothing I check for bad probe points and I find some bad looking around <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> , I find out path was gone between <CAPACITOR>C7604</CAPACITOR> and <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> , <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> i think create [SIZE=12px][FONT=Courier][FONT=Courier]=PPCPUVCCIO_S0_REG [/FONT][/FONT][/SIZE]so i guess fan will not spin without that rail , i rebuild the path with a wire and machine power on and works great thank you!
